address: 150 E 50th St, New York, NY 10022, United States
name: Spice Symphony

reviews.review: Apetizers were good. Main course could have been better.
This is such a delicious spot. The service is impeccable. I would come here again and again!
Love their Indo Chinese food.
Great food! Spices were good, naan was great, and loved the daal. Serving sizes were pretty big too  the only thing is that kitchen closed a bit early, otherwise good!
Authentic Indian food with the perfect amount of spice!! Will definitely visit again
Delicious!
Quite good indian food..
They take a long time to attend and just as they deliver your food in a few they are very slow

Their salt and pepper prawn was superb. We also ordered butter chicken and naan. All items were excellent. They also confirmed that their meat is halal. Service was great as well. It's quite a bit pricey, but the food won't disappoint you. Highly recommended.
Indo-chinese food is good. Quantity for 2 was just perfect! The place was a bit crowded and noisy though.
Nothing for the next 25 blocks comes close to serving this quality of Indian Chinese cuisine. Spice symphony is truly exceptional.
Ultimate taste of chicken briyani- oh man after a week of tour felt like home taste
Good food

We had Indian Chinese dinner there and it was surprising excellent.  Usually Indian Chinese dishes tend to flavored by chillies, ginger, garlic, and battered in corn flour. But here all the dishes had their own unique flavors.  The simple
Our server treated us with far less courtesy than those who didn't "look" Indian. On top of this rude service, food was just about okay and the ambience is dated. Avoid at all costs!
The food is great, but service seemed to have gone down a bit. In the rush to release food from kitchen,  quality is getting compromised.
Fabulous
Great food, lovely ambience and most of all great service by Nisar. We were there for a birthday and he was so kind to accommodate our surprise desert request, with a complimentary appetizer
Pleasant and fine ambiance, most of appetizers we tried are ok, very less in quantity. Curries carry a dominance of spicy and tamarind tastes but overall good.

The food was delicious. They close at 10 and we reached there by 9:15. We ordered soup and dinner (curry, naan, raita) but they served soup later after dinner. I understand it was their closing time but the staff was very rude. Prices are

If an Indian restaurant in NYC, a city full of nice eateries, could stay at top 10 for years then it must be really good!!  It was our second time visiting in 5 years and it did not dissapoint. The lamb biryani was to die for! Its full of
Solid chicken tikka masala a d garlic naan. The only issue is they didnt ask me how spicy I wanted it and I forget to tell them so it was American spicy, which is not that spicy.
We went there for lunch on Sunday and was offered dinner menu. The entrees were priced at the dinner rate but the potions were extremely small. Food was delicious but was not enough for 2 people.
Owner Prem is an amazing guy. We came almost on closing time but he let us in & served amazing food. Thanks a lot!
Good food, polite staff and decent ambience.
Good Food , Good Service !
Amazing food & excellent service. Owner Prem is an amazing guy. We came almost on closing time but he let us in & served amazing food. Thanks a lot!
Excellent dinner for four tonight.  We had vegetarian entries, two types of soup, reita, garlic nan - everything was just delicious.  I highly recommend this restaurant.

Plz call and go only if they pick up. Went all the way during their working hours ( Monday 7pm sorts ) and they were closed. Had called them the IVR system on phone did not even mention that it was closed.

We made reservations for a friend's birthday. The moment we came in, we were greeted warmly. Covid restrictions were also followed. Our temperatures were taken, we were given hand sanitizers, everyone was wearing masks. The staff was

Loved this place!! Great food, and the staff will bend over backwards to make sure that you have a good experience. The back servers do a great job keeping the table maintained, and the atmosphere is calm and groovy. I would recommend the Indian dishes, especially the peshawari naan.

Decided to try this place while visiting NYC with my boys. The staff were very nice and the restaurant is a nice place. However my sons water glass was dirty so they gave us a free appetizer. I ordered samosas for starters and the were the
Authentic Indo Chinese food. Great service
Some of the best Indian food I've eaten. We tried the paneer with spinach and the tellicherry pepper chicken and the garlic naan.

Not sure how the place has highest reviews of all Indian restaurants in NY. Food is ok, but not the best as I see other reviews. Definitely can use some face-lift . Menu is very outdated and definitely can be updated.

The food here is amazing! We were craving for indo Chinese since we came to the states, that is since 2 years and this was one of our best experiences with Indo Chinese! My personal best delicacies here were Chinese Bhel (must have) and veg
Goan fish, eggplant, okra, & service were all terrific

I learned of Spice Symphony through Yelp and my boyfriend and I headed out to explore it. Since then, we have been back a dozen times, each time the exquisite food just explodes on our pallets! You can't go wrong with the spinach chaat, the
Best Indian Chinese in the US!!!!
Solid indo chinese
Highly recommend!! The food,and  experience was amazing! By far the best Indian food in NYC. The all people make you feel welcome, and are always sure that the food will be of top quality.
Considerate owner attempted to help me resolve an issue with Uber Eats.  Great customer service.  Hope I actually get to try them the next time I am in NYC.
Great Indian food place suitable for large groups as well . Must try the Indian Chinese .

Highly recommend!! The food,and  experience was amazing! By far the best Indian food in NYC. The staff make you feel welcome, and are always sure that the food will be of top quality. We will definitely be coming back.

The host is very welcoming. Often you get a welcome dish (potato fritters in our case) from the Chef.. The indo chinese cuisine is the best I have had so far in NYC. I usually order the spicy chili garlic noodles (It's not in their menu..!!)
It seemed like a very well kept restaurant! Easy pick up, as a delivery driver i was out of there in 3 minutes!
This spot is great! Affordable rates, large portions and the staff members are always helpful.
A good place with a Variety of Indian food, good options for non meat eatersPolite and caring Indian staff, which together create a unique atmosphere of distinctive India.
Rude Staff. I ordered food via seamless. Received wrong item. Staff was terribly offensive and unapologetic.

Awesome place - I always come here for Indian food. Nisar is an awesome host and owner. I love this place and its food and it also has halal food for those interested. The service is also excellent. I'd highly recommend it.

A good place! Variety of Indian food, good options for non meat eaters (which was especially important to us). Polite and caring Indian staff, which together create a unique atmosphere of distinctive India. Special thanks to the manager named Nisar. We tried everything he recommended and everything turned out to be amazingly tasty!

Absolutely love the Indo-chinese food here. Havent tried the North & South Indian dishes yet but Im sure theyre equally amazing. The cocktails are very interesting and unique. Our personal favorites are in the saffron martini and Konkan

This place is amazing.The staff is the very best, especially this one patronThe food is awesome, the atmosphere and dining experience is classy and very nice, even with outdoor dining. Definitely will come back
Nice place, delicious food. Had dinner with a friend here last time. We'll come back for sure.
This place is amazing.The food is awesome, the atmosphere and dining experience is classy and very nice
amazing place & delecious meals
I adore this place the ambience is good, their menu is large ,the food was great .their Chicken lollipop is a must to try.The chef in that restaurant is a professional , the owner and the staff are

Had dinner here for Valentine's day. The food is amazing and the service is superb. I love the owner's thoughtful touch of preparing roses and chocolate  for all the couples here on date. Will definitely return and try more dishes on their menu!
The ambience is good, the food was greattheir Chicken lollipop is a must to try.One of the best indo-chinese cuisine available in NYC. The owner's and the staff
Amazing food
Fresh, spicy, not heavy. It was phenomenal and the server Ramiz took such great care of us! New favorite.

Hit and miss.. I got the curry spinach and the manchow soup my first order  delish nice portions I ordered a 2nd time got the lamb kabobs dry and not too tasty I just hope it was an end of the night thing... or ill stick to the veges
Amazing fast service and very kind staffs. I will definitely come back and recommend this place to my friends! Creative menu! Food and drinks were amazing.
Delicious food! Ive always
I simply liked their dishes. I always get good customer service there. I highly recommend this place.Food and drinks were amazing.
One of the best Indian Chinese restaurant in the whole NYC the owner Mr Prem and there staff is very gentle and friendly
Goat biryani is to die for! In my opinion this is the best biryani you can find in Midtown.Try out rasmalai from this place if you haven't yet.
Amazing fast service and very kind staffs. I will definitely come back and recommend this place to my friends! The food was amazing
Best Indian food I have had! The Chicken Tikka Lunch Special is one of the best deals in the city.

I adore this place! They offer first-rate dishes, their menu is large, The chef in that restaurant is a professional, I like very much trying all their food. The dishes are always tasty, the service towards the customers  is helpful. I  go often to this restaurant and I not even once was unhappy. I recommend it with no hesitation.
Service is always excellent and delicious too. Price is just right. Will definitely come back here again. You can enjoy various kinds of foods for reasonable price.
Delicious indian food
Wow, what can I say? I walk here from UWS every time I have a craving for the BEST Indian food in the city & it never disappoints.
Really great food and nice service.
Came upon this restaurant by chance. The taste of chicken lollipop took me back to Indo-Chinese food we get back in India. Staff was courteous and followed Covid protocols.

Walking up Lexington Avenue, we were thinking about Indian food. Probably because of the many Indian restaurants between 23rd and 33rd St. We stopped and looked into two are three along the way, but nothing caught our interest. The name,

Spice Symphony has never failed us in  the last 3 years. We have become a frequent customer to this amazing Indian restaurant. Besides super tasty and good quality the portion sizes are also value for money. Staff is always very courteous
Outside....but great food and service!

Where do I start? Everyone knows Spice Symphony serves fantastic food, but what we experienced was beyond excellent.Well, Spice Symphony went above and beyond to make our special day (our third anniversary) even more special. I had informed
Great food, their service is amazing. Highly recommended!
Amazing & delicious foodThank-you to everyone working there!Great service always feels like family. Thank-you for giving exact homemade food
The best butternut squash soup I've ever had. Vegan options! Every bite was phenomenal. Warm, welcoming hospitality. Every covid precaution taken. Thanks for the excellent meal!
A Must go to restaurant in NYC.  Delicious food, great service, unbelievable time.

Very nice indian food. We tried the bagare baigan and malai ke paneer tikke, both of them were really good. I like my food a bit spicier than the usual Indian food here in the US and they were very accommodating! So feel free to ask
Delicious,
Amazing food with lots different option to choose from including regular food but also gluten free, vegan etc really fantastic plus great service and big space for Big families !
It was great as usual. Vegetable manchurian is the beat attraction there. They put the tables outside and it was nice. The service was great. All the folks were wearing masks.
Excellent food, outstanding service.I will be coming back again.

Its pretty good Indian cuisine. However, the portions are pretty large and the price is also factored into this. I think it is pretty worth it definitely if your in the area. Lastly the dinning aesthetic and customer service is amazing.
Please come here if you want to taste heaven.This is one the best Indian restaurants I have been to in NYC. Like literally THE BEST
Everything was absolutely delicious!
I love this restaurant so much food is so  good and people who work here there are so nice specialty one of my favorite one nisar   Thank you for everything
The food is always well prepared and delightful, employees gives great service. I really like how clean it is and mood. Would recommend to others.
Loves spicy!
AMAZING! Love the food here, perfect mix of Indian & Chinese!
Outstanding food - a real hidden gem. The Indochinese portion of the menu is a delight if you have had good examples of both in the past.

The best Indian food I have ever had in NY/NJ.. Delicious, authentic Indian food!! Friendly staff!! Do try some Indian cocktails Django Mango, Konkan Coast were my favorite!! Please do not miss to visit this awesome place!

Great food from the Indian-Chinese border region, with staples such as Hakka noodles and tandoori chicken. Of particular interest to vegetarians and vegans will be their recently upgraded menu, which has some particularly delicious options,

This place is amazing... The staff is the very best, especially this one patron(so sorry I did not get his name) he was TOP NOTCH with customer service and interaction... The food is awesome, the atmosphere and dining experience is classy and very nice, even with outdoor dining. Definitely will come back... Great date night
Omg this place is so good. They are open for outdoor dining.First the service is great, very nice people. Our server, Nisar, was very sweet.
Great place, outside lunch/dinner, delicious food and outstanding service! Nisar took great care of us and dessert was on them... 5 stars
Best food best service
Extremely gracious owner. Very well prepared and tasty cuisine even as a pickup.
Excellent service, indian Chinese food was really tasty.
Nisar provided great service :) Gobi manchu was not sweet and really delicious!
One of my go-to spots to grab something to eat. fantastic location, well organised, and fantastic customer service. I highly recommend them!
Delicious flavors of Indian and Chinese. Truly unique and delicious. Must try!
We had a wonderful lunch with great service and hospitality thank you & see you soon!!!
Such delicious food!! Try the Goan Fish Curry- it has a unique flavor and isnt too spicy! The sweet corn chicken soup is also amazing.

Amazing food and service, Mithun was an exceptional host and server. Highly recommend the tellicherri pepper chicken!  Covid-19 precautions were taken very seriously, utensils wrapped and hand sanitizer provided. Will be back.

Went to Spice Symphony for our first post-quarantine dinner in Manhattan. We ate outside, the utensils and napkins were wrapped, and we were offered hand sanitizer. Staff were all wearing masks. We were happy to see Covid-19 precautions
Exquisite one of the best restaurants I have every been to.

This deceptively laidback restaurant offers delicious Indian food in a refined atmosphere, with attentive staff and a lovely menu. Both their vegetarian and their meat dishes are equally good: we shared the chicken tikka masala, aloo gobi,
Amazing tasty food
It's to BAD, vert very bad...
Delicious

Let me start by saying, I dont like to try new food and new places. Im usually a same place same order kind of girl. There was an Indian food place by where i live and then all of a sudden it closed down. Ive been looking for a

We had a pre-theater dinner here as it was adjacent to our hotel. What a treat! The food was delicious and the service amazing. It felt like we had 3 or 4 servers always keeping an eye on us to be sure we had what we needed and that we were

Service was great. We ordered paneer chilly which was one of the best I ever had. Main course was a bit sweet . Could have been better. Garlic naan was great.  And so was the cheesecake. They provided us with complementary pakode, rice and cake because it was one of ours birthday. Will surely visit again .
The place serves large portions and for fair prices. super friendly staff members. They never disappoint.
The food was excellent and the service was better than excellent. I'm super happy I gave it a try and you will be too!
Went with my wife and in laws. Served by Akbar, who was professional, courteous and the food was amazing. It was my in-laws first time having Indian food and they are converted! Thanks Akbar
Went for the brunch special they have on the weekends.  It was worth every penny.The food was amazing and the service was great!
Love this place. Will be back for sure to try more dishes
Love it, love it, love it.Don't get distracted by the construction around, get inside and see the cozy ambiance.  Everybody will greet you with a smile. It was our first time with Indian
Great indochinese food. Reminded me of Mumbai street food
Excellent welcome, waiter who makes the effort to explain the menu (rare in NY) and very good meal overall ... Very good restaurant
Simply put, this restaurant was fabulous in every way. The flavors burst out of the food with every bite. The service was exceptional. I simply cannot say enough nice words about Spice Symphony.
Fine dining for date and families in back. Front half is more casual. Delicious food... fine dining service from Nisar. Fun talking about my days in Nepal with Bahini
Amazing food really good food!!!

WOW!  Just left the restaurant and couldnt wait to post this!  Just had what might be the best meal Ive had in a year.  My friend and I flew in from Florida this morning with the intention of eating our way through NYC.  We love Indian

We were in the area and were looking for a good restaurant near by, Spice Symphony came up highly rated and we decided to try it. . We tried plenty of Indian restaurants in NY, but could not find the one we loved. Turned out to be really
Amazing Indian. Super authentic and there prices are great.

I really liked the food and the ambience. The service was good and the staff friendly. It was a New Years Eve hence packed; had to wait extra few min but it was worth it. If you are craving for good Indian food, try this place
Good food, a bit expensive tough
Indian food here is well executed with new spices to discover each time we visit!
Delicious! If you like hot food, you will love this place. Chicken fried rice was so good and so hot. Everyone was pleasant. The non fried rice is fantastic as well. I could eat the just the rice.

Whilst visiting New York back in october we were lucky enough to have found this lovely restaurant, the food was fantastic, staff most friendly and helpful, we all had our own ideas of the Indian food to which we were used to and our waiter

Nice place to eat. Good food and good service. Mr. Aldi recommend us some specialties and the food really good. I strongly recommend this place if you are looking for quality food at a very reasonable price.
